series_for_budget: Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade
Department of the Prime Minister and Cabinet
Office of the Clerk of the House of Representatives

Canterbury Earthquake Recovery Authority.name: Managing the Recovery
Canterbury Earthquake Recovery Authority.scope: This appropriation is limited to expenses incurred in managing the recovery from the Canterbury Earthquakes.

Canterbury Earthquake Recovery Authority.name: Canterbury Earthquake Property Demolitions and Related Costs and Compensation
Canterbury Earthquake Recovery Authority.scope: This appropriation is limited to tasks necessary to proceed with and expedite demolitions associated with the Canterbury earthquakes and related compensation to property owners.

Canterbury Earthquake Recovery Authority.name: Management of Voluntarily Acquired Insured Residential Red Zone Properties
Canterbury Earthquake Recovery Authority.scope: This appropriation is limited to expenses related to third party providers involved in transactions associated with the Crown’s acquisition of voluntarily acquired insured residential red zone properties in Canterbury.

Canterbury Earthquake Recovery Authority.name: Policy Advice
Canterbury Earthquake Recovery Authority.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of advice (including second opinion advice and contributions to policy advice led by other agencies) to support decision-making by Ministers on government policy matters relating to the Canterbury Earthquake Recovery.

Canterbury Earthquake Recovery Authority.name: Contributions towards legal fees
Canterbury Earthquake Recovery Authority.scope: This appropriation is limited to contributions towards legal fees incurred by property owners in the Red Zones in Canterbury selling properties to the Crown.

Canterbury Earthquake Recovery Authority.name: Canterbury Earthquake Demolition-Related Property Purchases
Canterbury Earthquake Recovery Authority.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase of land and buildings if required for demolition tasks ordered by the Canterbury Earthquake Recovery Authority.

Canterbury Earthquake Recovery Authority.name: Canterbury Earthquake Recovery Authority - Capital Expenditure
Canterbury Earthquake Recovery Authority.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the Canterbury Earthquake Recovery Authority, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

Controller and Auditor-General.name: Audit and Assurance Services
Controller and Auditor-General.scope: This appropriation is limited to audit and related assurance services as required or authorised by statute.

Controller and Auditor-General.name: Performance Audits and Inquiries
Controller and Auditor-General.scope: This output class is limited to undertaking and reporting on performance audits and inquiries relating to public entities under the Public Audit Act 2001 and responding to requests for approvals in relation to pecuniary interest questions regulated by the Local Authorities Members’ Interests Act 1968.

Controller and Auditor-General.name: Controller and Auditor-General - Capital Expenditure
Controller and Auditor-General.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the Controller and Auditor-General, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

Controller and Auditor-General.name: Supporting Accountability to Parliament
Controller and Auditor-General.scope: This output class is limited to reporting to Parliament and others as appropriate on matters arising from audits and inquiries, reporting to and advising select committees, and advising other agencies in New Zealand and abroad to support Parliament and governing bodies in holding their executives to account for the use of public resources.

Controller and Auditor-General.name: Remuneration of Auditor-General and Deputy Auditor-General
Controller and Auditor-General.scope: This appropriation is limited to remuneration expenses for both the Auditor-General and the Deputy Auditor-General as authorised by clause 5 of the Third Schedule of the Public Audit Act 2001.

Crown Law Office.name: Conduct of Crown Prosecutions
Crown Law Office.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of a national Crown prosecution service that undertakes criminal trials on indictment.

Crown Law Office.name: Legal Advice and Representation
Crown Law Office.scope: Providing legal advice and representation services to central government departments and Crown agencies.

Crown Law Office.name: Conduct of Criminal Appeals
Crown Law Office.scope: This output class is limited to conducting appeals in the High Court, the Court of Appeal and the Supreme Court arising from criminal trials on indictment including Crown appeals.

Crown Law Office.name: The Exercise of Principal Law Officer Functions
Crown Law Office.scope: Providing legal advice, representation services and administrative services to the Attorney-General and Solicitor-General to assist them in the exercise of their Principal Law Officer functions, and the provision of legal and constitutional advice to the Government, Ministers, and the judiciary.

Crown Law Office.name: Criminal Law Advice and Services
Crown Law Office.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of advice on criminal law, mutual assistance and extradition matters to other government agencies and to Crown Solicitors.

Crown Law Office.name: Supervision of the Crown Solicitor Network
Crown Law Office.scope: This output class is limited to the supervision of the network of Crown Solicitors who deliver prosecution services.

Crown Law Office.name: Crown Law Office - Capital Expenditure
Crown Law Office.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the Crown Law Office, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

Department of Building and Housing.name: Purchase of Housing and Related Services for Tenants Paying Income Related Rent
Department of Building and Housing.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase of housing and related services delivered by Housing New Zealand Corporation to individuals who are eligible for an income related rent, assessed as the difference in price between the amounts of market rents for the housing provided by the Corporation and the income related rents charged.

Department of Building and Housing.name: Refinancing of Housing New Zealand Corporation and Housing New Zealand Limited Debt
Department of Building and Housing.scope: This appropriation is limited to refinancing existing Housing New Zealand Corporation and Housing New Zealand Limited debt.

Department of Building and Housing.name: Weathertight Services
Department of Building and Housing.scope: This appropriation is limited to assessing the eligibility of weathertight homes claims; independent technical assessment of claims, including reports on actual and probable damage with estimated costs of repair; administration of the financial assistance package; claim management until repair or claim lodged with the Weathertight Tribunal; provision of mediation services; and advice, information and education to support more informed consumer decisions.

Department of Building and Housing.name: Wellington City Council Social Housing Assistance
Department of Building and Housing.scope: This appropriation is limited to assisting the Wellington City Council upgrade its social housing portfolio under the terms of a Deed of Grant entered into between the Crown, Housing New Zealand Corporation and the Council.

Department of Building and Housing.name: Social Housing Fund
Department of Building and Housing.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchasing of services from, or providing support to, third party providers of social and/or affordable housing services.

Department of Building and Housing.name: Residential Tenancy and Unit Title Services
Department of Building and Housing.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of residential tenancy and unit title dispute resolution services, information, education, and advice; administration and investment of residential tenancy bond monies; provision of administrative support to the State Housing Appeals Authority.

Department of Building and Housing.name: Building Regulation and Control
Department of Building and Housing.scope: This appropriation is limited to activities associated with the setting of performance standards for buildings and the design and delivery of regulatory schemes and other initiatives to help ensure those standards are met.

Department of Building and Housing.name: KiwiSaver Deposit Subsidy
Department of Building and Housing.scope: To enable the provision of the KiwiSaver deposit subsidy for people who meet the required eligibility criteria.

Department of Building and Housing.name: HNZC Housing Support Services
Department of Building and Housing.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase of housing related services from Housing New Zealand Corporation including home ownership initiatives, the Housing Innovation Fund and Healthy Housing.

Department of Building and Housing.name: Acquisition and Development of properties under the Housing Act 1955
Department of Building and Housing.scope: This appropriation is limited to acquiring, developing and modernising properties under the Housing Act 1955.

Department of Building and Housing.name: Canterbury Earthquakes: Emergency and Temporary Accommodation
Department of Building and Housing.scope: This appropriation is limited to operating expenses incurred on emergency and temporary accommodation for people displaced by the Canterbury earthquakes.

Department of Building and Housing.name: Occupational Licensing
Department of Building and Housing.scope: This appropriation is limited to the development, implementation and maintenance of the registration and licensing regimes for building practitioners and electrical workers.

Department of Building and Housing.name: Increase in Debt Provision
Department of Building and Housing.scope: Increase in provision for doubtful debts on Income Related Rents Crown Debt.

Department of Building and Housing.name: MCOA - Housing Policy Advice
Department of Building and Housing.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of advice (including second opinion advice and contributions to policy advice led by other agencies) to support decision making by Ministers on government policy matters relating to Housing.

Department of Building and Housing.name: Acquisition and Improvement of Housing New Zealand Corporation state houses
Department of Building and Housing.scope: This appropriation is limited to debt or equity in Housing New Zealand Corporation to acquire, modernise or reconfigure Housing New Zealand Corporation state houses.

Department of Building and Housing.name: Community Housing Rent Relief Programme
Department of Building and Housing.scope: This appropriation is limited to provision of a rent relief fund for service provider tenants of Community Group Housing properties who face difficulties in meeting rental payments.

Department of Building and Housing.name: Weathertight Services: Guarantee Fee Subsidy
Department of Building and Housing.scope: This appropriation is limited to the expense reflecting the guarantee fee subsidy under the Weathertight Services Financial Assistance Package: Loan Guarantee scheme.

Department of Building and Housing.name: MCOA - Building and Construction Policy
Department of Building and Housing.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of advice (including second opinion advice and contributions to policy advice led by other agencies) to support decision making by Ministers on government policy matters relating to Building and Construction.

Department of Building and Housing.name: Social Housing Unit
Department of Building and Housing.scope: This appropriation is limited to the administration costs of the Social Housing Unit.

Department of Building and Housing.name: Canterbury Earthquakes: Building and Housing Assistance
Department of Building and Housing.scope: This appropriation is limited to the co-ordination, management and delivery of the overall Departmental response programme, and the delivery of accommodation matching and placement services to people displaced by the Canterbury earthquakes.

Department of Building and Housing.name: Housing Assistance
Department of Building and Housing.scope: Payments made to HNZC and other mortgage providers to compensate for the difference between the cost of funds and rate at which funds are lent and provide write-offs for loans.

Department of Building and Housing.name: Management of Crown Properties held under the Housing Act 1955
Department of Building and Housing.scope: This appropriation is limited to the administration and management of Crown owned properties held under the Housing Act 1955.

Department of Building and Housing.name: Department of Building and Housing - Capital Expenditure
Department of Building and Housing.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the Department of Building and Housing, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

Department of Building and Housing.name: Unwind of Discount Rate used in the Present Value Calculation of Direct Payments under the Weathertight Homes Financial Assistance Package.
Department of Building and Housing.scope: This appropriation is limited to the expense incurred in unwinding the discount rate used in the present value calculation of the Weathertight Homes Financial Assistance Package liability as the liability nears settlement.

Department of Building and Housing.name: MCOA - Housing, Ministerial Servicing and Performance and Monitoring
Department of Building and Housing.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of support, information and services to the Minister of Housing to enable the Minister to discharge their portfolio responsibilities (other than policy decision making).

Department of Building and Housing.name: Payments in respect of the Weathertight Services Loan Guarantees
Department of Building and Housing.scope: This appropriation is limited to the payments to banks under the Weathertight Services Financial Assistance Package: Loan Guarantee scheme as authorised under section 65ZG of the Public Finance Act 1989.

Department of Building and Housing.name: MCOA - Building and Construction Ministerial Servicing
Department of Building and Housing.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of support, information and services to the Minister for Building and Construction to enable the Minister to discharge their portfolio responsibilities (other than policy decision making).

Department of Building and Housing.name: Capital Injections to Housing New Zealand Corporation for Housing Activities
Department of Building and Housing.scope: Capital injections (debt or equity) to HNZC to give effect to Government policy decisions around stock acquisition, modernisation and other housing interventions.

Department of Conservation.name: Management of Natural Heritage
Department of Conservation.scope: This appropriation is limited to maintaining, restoring and protecting ecosystems, habitats and species.

Department of Conservation.name: Management of Recreational Opportunities
Department of Conservation.scope: This appropriation is limited to recreational facilities and services, and the management of business concessions.

Department of Conservation.name: Department of Conservation - Capital Expenditure
Department of Conservation.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the Department of Conservation, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

Department of Conservation.name: Conservation with the Community
Department of Conservation.scope: This appropriation is limited to educational and public awareness services, and facilitation of community involvement and community-led conservation activities.

Department of Conservation.name: NZ Biodiversity Funds
Department of Conservation.scope: This appropriation is limited to the payment of grants: to provide private land managers with information and advice, or assistance with costs of pest and weed control, fencing and other biodiversity management actions; and to support community biodiversity restoration initiatives.

Department of Conservation.name: Impairment of Public Conservation Land
Department of Conservation.scope: This appropriation is limited to the impairment in value of Public Conservation land to be transferred to iwi as part of Treaty of Waitangi Settlements.

Department of Conservation.name: South Island Landless Natives Act
Department of Conservation.scope: This output class is limited to the identification and implementation of protection of indigenous ecosystems in Maori ownership on South Island Landless Natives Act (SILNA) land.

Department of Conservation.name: Management of Historic Heritage
Department of Conservation.scope: This appropriation is limited to the protection and conservation management of historic heritage.

Department of Conservation.name: Nga Whenua Rahui
Department of Conservation.scope: This output class is limited to the identification and implementation of protection of indigenous ecosystems on Maori land.

Department of Conservation.name: Policy Advice
Department of Conservation.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of advice (including second opinion advice and contributions to policy advice led by other agencies) to support decision-making by Ministers on government policy matters relating to conservation.

Department of Conservation.name: Statutory Planning, Services to Ministers and Statutory Bodies
Department of Conservation.scope: This output class is limited to statutory planning and the provision of services to Ministers (other than policy decision making responsibilities) and statutory bodies to enable them to discharge their portfolio and responsibilities.

Department of Conservation.name: Crown Contribution to Regional Pest Management Strategies
Department of Conservation.scope: This appropriation is limited to controlling weed and animal pests on lands administered by the Department of Conservation to meet negotiated outcomes of regional pest management strategies.

Department of Conservation.name: Nature Heritage Fund
Department of Conservation.scope: This output class is limited to the identification and implementation of protection of indigenous ecosystems on private land.

Department of Conservation.name: Legal Protection Queen Elizabeth II
Department of Conservation.scope: This output class is limited to identification and implementation of protection of biodiversity on private land.

Department of Conservation.name: Management Services - Natural and Historic Places
Department of Conservation.scope: This appropriation is limited to management services for properties with historical or natural significance, including maintenance work, access for the public and management advice on covenanted properties.

Department of Conservation.name: Purchase and Development of Reserves
Department of Conservation.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase of conservation land, including the purchase of reserves, and any associated administration costs as provided for under the Reserves Act 1977.

Department of Conservation.name: Crown Land Acquisitions
Department of Conservation.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase of property for the Conservation Estate.

Department of Conservation.name: Matauranga Maori Fund
Department of Conservation.scope: This appropriation is limited to making grants to support initiatives to protect traditional Maori knowledge relating to NZ’s indigenous biodiversity.

Department of Conservation.name: Depreciation - Crown Property, Plant and Equipment
Department of Conservation.scope: This appropriation is limited to the depreciation on Crown property, plant and equipment on Crown land administered by the Department of Conservation.

Department of Conservation.name: Payment of Rates on Properties for Concessionaires
Department of Conservation.scope: This appropriation is limited to the payment of rates: on reserves; conservation areas that are used for private or commercial purposes; and for services provided by a local authority.

Department of Conservation.name: Vesting of Reserves
Department of Conservation.scope: This appropriation is limited to the costs incurred in vesting Crown reserves in third parties, and Crown contributions towards the purchase of reserves by third parties.

Department of Conservation.name: Loss on Disposal of Crown Property, Plant and Equipment
Department of Conservation.scope: This appropriation is limited to losses incurred on the disposal of Crown property, plant and equipment.

Department of Conservation.name: Stewart Island Infrastructure
Department of Conservation.scope: This appropriation is limited to assistance to the Southland District Council for additional community infrastructure arising from increased visitor numbers on Stewart Island.

Department of Conservation.name: Subscriptions to International Organisations
Department of Conservation.scope: This appropriation is limited to meeting annual subscriptions to international conservation organisations.

Department of Conservation.name: Waikaremoana Lakebed Lease
Department of Conservation.scope: This appropriation is limited to payments made under the Lake Waikaremoana Act 1971 for the lease of the lakebed and foreshore for conservation purposes.

Department of Conservation.name: Provision for Bad and Doubtful Debts
Department of Conservation.scope: This appropriation is limited to the write-off of debts relating to Crown Revenue.

Department of Conservation.name: Compensation Payments
Department of Conservation.scope: This appropriation is limited to making obligatory compensation payments: when esplanade reserves are created, and upon vesting of coastal marine areas in the Crown.

Department of Conservation.name: Moutoa Gardens/Pakaitore
Department of Conservation.scope: This appropriation is limited to the ongoing management and maintenance of the Moutoa Gardens Reserve.

Department of Corrections.name: Prison-based Custodial Services
Department of Corrections.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of custodial services for offenders lawfully required to be detained in custody.  This includes remand prisoners (people awaiting trial, and offenders convicted but not yet sentenced), those offenders sentenced to imprisonment, and any other offender required to be lawfully detained in custody.

Department of Corrections.name: Department of Corrections  - Capital Expenditure
Department of Corrections.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the Department of Corrections, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

Department of Corrections.name: Sentences and Orders Served in the Community
Department of Corrections.scope: This appropriation is limited to the management and delivery of sentences and orders served in the community.

Department of Corrections.name: Rehabilitation and Reintegration
Department of Corrections.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of case management and interventions designed to address the underlying causes of criminal re-offending.

Department of Corrections.name: Information and Administrative Services to the Judiciary and New Zealand Parole Board
Department of Corrections.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of information about offenders to victims of crime, the Judiciary and the New Zealand Parole Board, and the provision of administrative, financial and secretariat services to the New Zealand Parole Board.

Department of Corrections.name: Policy Advice
Department of Corrections.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of advice (including second opinion advice and contributions to policy advice led by other agencies) to support decision-making by Ministers on government policy matters.

Department of Corrections.name: Contract Management of Services provided by Third Parties
Department of Corrections.scope: This appropriation is limited to preparing for and managing contracts for the provision of services provided by third parties.

Department of Corrections.name: Ministerial Services
Department of Corrections.scope: This output class is limited to Department responses to ministerial correspondence and parliamentary questions.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Managing and Accessing Identity Information
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to providing effective management of New Zealand's records of identity including: issuing New Zealand passports; processing citizenship applications; and registering births, deaths, marriages and civil unions; developing authorised information-matching programmes with specified government agencies; providing data or data verification to government agencies, to enhance border processes and facilitate travel; working across government to develop systems and processes for the verification and authentication of identity and to facilitate good practice based on Evidence of Identity Standard, and authenticating official documents and coordinating the congratulatory message service.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Managing and Accessing Knowledge Information
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to management of public archives in both physical and digital formats on behalf of the Crown, the provision of public access to archives held by Archives New Zealand, provision of services which assist access to library collections and other information, the collection and preservation of published and unpublished items for the National Library and Alexander Turnbull Library collections, provision of library and information services and products to schools in support of the National Curriculum, and administration of the Public Lending Right for New Zealand Authors Scheme.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Department of Internal Affairs - Capital Expenditure
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the Department of Internal Affairs, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Rates Rebates Scheme
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: Assistance with rates for low-income residential ratepayers.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Regulatory Services
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of operational policy advice and services to administer all aspects of the regulatory regime under the Public Records Act 2005, including where the Chief Archivist has statutory independence; services to regulate gambling activity, objectionable material and unsolicited electronic messages, and anti-money laundering and countering financing of terrorism; and the Private Security Personnel and Private Investigators Regulations 2011.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Support Services to Members of the Executive
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to providing support services for Members of the Executive, including in their capacity as a Member of Parliament, primarily through office personnel and administrative services, information and communication technology, and the provision and management of residential accommodation.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Community Organisation Grants Scheme
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: Locally distributed grants to community organisations for programmes that direct social services provision to disadvantaged community sectors.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Members of the Executive - Travel
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This appropriation is limited to the cost of domestic and international travel by Members of the Executive and approved accompanying parties.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Support for Grant Funding Bodies – Internal Affairs
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of operational and secretariat support for grant funding bodies, including supporting member appointment processes.  The focus of operational support is on processing grant applications and grant decisions on behalf of the grant funding bodies.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Executive Council and Members of the Executive - Salaries and Allowances PLA
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This appropriation is limited to the cost of salaries and allowances for the Executive Council and Members of the Executive, as authorised by section 2 of the Civil List Act 1979.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: VIP Transport Services
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to providing chauffeur-driven and self-drive vehicle services for parties specified in legislation, as authorised by Members of the Executive, or who otherwise meet qualifying criteria.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Government Information and Technology Services
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to the development, deployment and operation of technology services across the State sector.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Community Development and Engagement Advice
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to advisory services to assist and guide community development activities and to assist government agencies to engage and interact with communities and community groups.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Policy Advice - Local Government
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of advice (including second opinion advice and contributions to policy advice led by other agencies) to support decision-making by Ministers on government policy matters relating to local government.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Commissions of Inquiry & Similar Bodies
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to supporting commissions of inquiry and similar bodies.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Advisory and Information Services to Ethnic Communities
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of advisory and information services to ethnic communities; operational and secretariat support for grant funding bodies; management of the contract for the telephone interpreting service (Language Line); and provision of information and training to ethnic communities and agencies using Language Line.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Charities - Administration
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: Funding for the Charities Commission to fulfil its functions outlined in the Charities Act 2005.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Community Development Scheme
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: Three-year grants to community organisations for projects to achieve improved economic, social and cultural wellbeing in areas such as health, education and crime prevention

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Policy Advice - Internal Affairs
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of advice (including second opinion advice and contributions to policy advice led by other agencies) to support decision-making by Ministers on government policy matters relating to internal affairs, including regulatory and identity matters, all-of-government information and communications technology, the role of information in New Zealand’s cultural and economic life, public recordkeeping and the management of national archives, and other areas that fall within the internal affairs portfolio.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Coordination of Official Visits and Events
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to managing programmes for visiting guests of Government, State and ministerial functions, co-ordinating a range of services in support of ceremonial and commemorative events and facilitating passage of New Zealand and foreign dignitaries and others authorised by the Crown into and out of New Zealand.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Management of National Emergency Management Readiness, Response and Recovery
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to management of national emergency readiness, response and recovery, including: support to local civil defence emergency management organisations, maintaining the National Crisis Management Centre in a state of readiness, national training and education, coordination and management of central government's response and recovery activities and administration of related expenses.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Digital Literacy and Connection
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of funding to selected communities to improve their access to digital tools and improve the capability of those communities in the use of digital tools.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Emergency Sector Support and Development
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to developing and implementing operational policies and projects, advice, assistance and information to the civil defence and emergency management sector.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Administration of Grants
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This appropriation is limited to administration of the processes supporting government grant funding schemes, from receiving applications to monitoring grant recipients.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Local Government Services
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This appropriation is limited to providing information to and about local government, administering the Local Government Act 2002 and other statutes, administering the Local Electoral Act 2001, administering the Rates Rebate Scheme, providing regulatory and boating services for Lake Taupo (including providing the Harbourmaster and managing the Lake Taupo Landing Reserve) and governance and management of the National Dog Control Information Database.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Chatham Islands Council
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: Contribution to the cost of the Chatham Island Council meeting its statutory responsibilities.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Public Lending Right for New Zealand Authors
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This appropriation is limited to payment to New Zealand authors in recognition that their books are available for use in New Zealand libraries.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Classification of Films, Videos and Publications
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: The examination and classification of films, videos and publications by the Office of Film and Literature Classification under the Films, Videos, and Publications Classification Act 1993.  Provision of information and research on classification procedures and systems.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Policy Advice - Community and Voluntary Sector
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of advice (including second opinion advice and contributions to policy advice led by other agencies) to support decision-making by Ministers on government policy matters relating to the community and voluntary sector.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Community Information – Civil Defence Emergency Management
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to the development and delivery of long-term national programmes to raise individual and community awareness and preparedness.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Heritage Collections –  Annual
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: Purchase of material for the Alexander Turnbull Library collections held and managed by the National Library.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Tuwharetoa Maori Trust Board
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This appropriation is limited to payment to Tuwharetoa Maori Trust Board to provide for continued public access to Lake Taupo, based upon a 2007 agreement between the Crown and the Tuwharetoa Maori Trust Board.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Crown-owned Assets at Lake Taupo – Maintenance Costs
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This appropriation is limited to costs for maintaining Crown-owned assets, primarily navigational equipment, ramps, marinas and jetties, at Lake Taupo.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Statutory Body Support - Gambling Commission
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of services and advice to the Gambling Commission to enable the Commission to discharge its responsibilities.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Emergency Expenses
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: Payments from the Crown to meet emergency expenses in line with criteria as detailed in the National CDEM Plan.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Racing Safety Development Fund
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: A contestable fund to match racing industry contributions towards enhancing workplace safety and raising the quality of facilities at racecourses.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Publishing Civic Information
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to publishing information through the New Zealand Gazette.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Contestable Services
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: Providing translation and other language services to government agencies and the public, and support services to government agencies.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Subsidies to Local Government
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: Payments from the Crown to local authorities for emergency management preparation.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Community Archives Support
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to support for community, iwi and hapu organisations and other jurisdictions in preserving and managing their own records and archives and making them available.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Policy Advice - Ethnic Affairs
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of advice (including second opinion advice and contributions to policy advice led by other agencies) to support decision-making by Ministers on government policy matters relating to ethnic affairs.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Statutory Body Support - Local Government Commission
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of advisory and support services to the Local Government Commission in respect of its statutory functions.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Policy Advice - Emergency Management
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of advice (including second opinion advice and contributions to policy advice led by other agencies) to support decision-making by Ministers on government policy matters relating to civil defence and emergency management.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Pike River Royal Commission of Inquiry – Legal representation and assistance
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This appropriation is limited to meeting the costs of providing independent legal counsel to the families of the deceased Pike River miners, and financial assistance to the employees of, and contractors to, the Pike River Mine to obtain legal assistance in respect of the Royal Commission of Inquiry.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Public Inquiries
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: Fees for inquiries and investigations.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Crown Entity Monitoring
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to providing support, information and advice to Ministers to enable them to discharge their responsibilities (other than policy decision-making) for the Crown entities for which they are responsible.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Ministerial Support Services - Local Government
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of services to Ministers to enable them to discharge their portfolio (other than policy decision-making) responsibilities relating to local government.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Former Governors-General - Annuities and Other Payments
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This appropriation is limited to annuities and payments in respect of other benefits and privileges to former Governors-General and their surviving spouses or partners, as authorised by section 12 of the Governor-General Act 2010.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Support for Volunteering
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: Funding to promote the effective use, training and support of volunteers by funding Volunteering New Zealand, regional volunteer centres and various targeted projects within the community.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Ministerial Support Services – Internal Affairs
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of services to Ministers to enable them to discharge their portfolio (other than policy decision-making) responsibilities relating to internal affairs, including regulatory and identity matters, all-of-government information and communications technology, the role of information in New Zealand’s cultural and economic life, public recordkeeping and the management of national archives, and other areas that fall within the internal affairs portfolio.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Capital Investments – Lake Taupo
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: Upgrading of boating facilities at Lake Taupo. Provision of safety lighting and adequate warning of navigational hazards.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Community Internship Programme
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: Grants for community internship programmes to place experienced people from the public, private and community sectors in short-term internships to develop capacity in community and voluntary sector organisations.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Support for Grant Funding Bodies – Community and Voluntary Sector
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of operational and secretariat support for grant funding bodies, and includes supporting member appointment processes.  The focus of operational support is on processing grant applications and grant decisions on behalf of the grant funding bodies.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Te Oneroa a Tohe Beach Management
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This appropriation is limited to contributing to the Te Oneroa a Tohe beach management plan and associated joint committee operating costs.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Former Prime Ministers - Domestic Travel
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This appropriation is limited to the cost of domestic travel by former Prime Ministers and their spouses or partners pursuant to the Civil List Act 1979.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Ministerial Support Services - Ministerial Services
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of services to Ministers to enable them to discharge their portfolio (other than policy decision-making) responsibilities relating to Ministerial Services.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Youth Workers Training Scheme
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: Grants for informal training for both paid and voluntary youth workers to increase and maintain the quality of youth worker practice.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Policy Advice - Racing
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of advice (including second opinion advice and contributions to policy advice led by other agencies) to support decision-making by Ministers on government policy matters relating to racing.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Depreciation on Official Residences
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This appropriation is limited to depreciation on official residences owned by the Crown.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Former Prime Ministers – Annuities
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This appropriation is limited to annuities for former Prime Ministers and their surviving spouses or partners, as authorised by section 2 of the Civil List Act 1979.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Ministerial Support Services - Community and Voluntary Sector
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of services to Ministers to enable them to discharge their portfolio (other than policy decision-making) responsibilities relating to the community and voluntary sector.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Disarmament Education Grants
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: Grants to fund activities to support New Zealand non-government organisations in the disarmament education field.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Development of On-line Authentication Services
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This appropriation is limited to services provided by the Office of the Privacy Commissioner in the development of on-line authentication services.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Statutory and Advisory Body Support – National Archives
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of advisory and support services to statutory and advisory bodies with relation to Archives New Zealand to enable them to discharge their responsibilities.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Statutory and Advisory Body Support – National Library
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of services and advice to statutory and advisory bodies with relation to the National Library of New Zealand to enable them to discharge their responsibilities.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Ministerial Support Services - Ethnic Affairs
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of services to Ministers to enable them to discharge their portfolio (other than policy decision-making) responsibilities relating to ethnic affairs.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Miscellaneous Grants - Internal Affairs
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: Miscellaneous Grant payments to individuals or organisations to assist in building a strong and safe nation through serving and connecting citizens, communities and Government.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Ministerial Support Services – Emergency Management
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of services to Ministers to enable them to discharge their portfolio (other than policy decision-making) responsibilities relating to civil defence and emergency management.

Department of Internal Affairs.name: Ministerial Support Services - Racing
Department of Internal Affairs.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of services to Ministers to enable them to discharge their portfolio (other than policy decision-making) responsibilities relating to racing.

Department of Labour.name: Rehabilitation Entitlements and Services
Department of Labour.scope: To cover the cost of purchasing medical services, social rehabilitation and elective health care services on the Non-Earners' Account and contracted services.

Department of Labour.name: Public Health Acute Services
Department of Labour.scope: To fund public health acute services for claims on the Non-Earners' Account.

Department of Labour.name: Immigration Services
Department of Labour.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of customer services that include facilitation and processing of visa applications, the management of New Zealand's immigration intelligence, risk and integrity systems, and response to settlement needs and community initiatives to encourage migrant participation.  Funding for international membership in immigration forums is also provided.

Department of Labour.name: Rehabilitation Entitlements and Services - Treatment Injuries for Non-Earners'
Department of Labour.scope: This appropriation is limited to cover the cost of purchasing medical services, social rehabilitation and elective health care services and contracted services for claims by non-earners' on the Treatment Injury Account.

Department of Labour.name: Case Management and Supporting Services
Department of Labour.scope: To cover the cost of injury prevention, claim processing, assessment, payment services and case management on the Non-Earners' Account.

Department of Labour.name: Health and Safety Services
Department of Labour.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of information, education and support for workplaces regarding effective workplace health and safety practice, and enforcement action to promote compliance with the Health and Safety in Employment Act 1992 and related regulations.

Department of Labour.name: Department of Labour - Capital Expenditure
Department of Labour.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the Department of Labour, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

Department of Labour.name: Compensation Entitlements - Treatment Injuries for Non-Earners'
Department of Labour.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of income maintenance, independence allowance, and other compensation payments for claims by non-earners' on the Treatment Injury Account.

Department of Labour.name: Employment Relations Services
Department of Labour.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of information, guidance, investigation, mediation and decision-making regarding employment rights and upholding regulatory standards including support services provided to employment relations institutions.

Department of Labour.name: Compensation Entitlements
Department of Labour.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of income maintenance, independence allowance, and other compensation payments for claims on the Non-Earners' Account.

Department of Labour.name: Case Management and Supporting Services - Treatment Injuries for Non-Earners'
Department of Labour.scope: This appropriation is limited to cover the cost of injury prevention, claim lodgement and management, investment management and appropriation setting for claims by non-earners' on the Treatment Injury Account.

Department of Labour.name: Refugee and Protection Services
Department of Labour.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of refugee customer services that include selection, travel and resettlement of quota refugees, protection determinations and support processes for claimants.  Funding is also provided for preparedness to respond to a humanitarian crisis.

Department of Labour.name: Policy Advice - Labour
Department of Labour.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of advice (including second opinion advice and contributions to policy advice led by other agencies) to support decision-making by Ministers on government policy matters relating to employment relations, health and safety (including Hazardous Substances and New Organisms) and international labour commitments.

Department of Labour.name: Policy Advice - Immigration
Department of Labour.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of advice (including second opinion advice and contributions to policy advice led by other agencies) to support decision-making by Ministers on government policy matters relating to immigration policy and international immigration commitments.

Department of Labour.name: Ministerial Services
Department of Labour.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of services to Ministers to enable them to discharge their portfolio (other than policy decision-making) responsibilities.

Department of Labour.name: Labour Market Policy Advice
Department of Labour.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of advice (including second opinion advice and contributions to policy advice led by other agencies) to support decision-making by Ministers on government policy matters relating to the labour market and employment policy.

Department of Labour.name: Employment Relations Authority Members' Salaries and Allowances
Department of Labour.scope: As set by the Remuneration Authority in order to administer and enforce employment-related legislation (section 171 of the Employment Relations Act 2000).

Department of Labour.name: Hazardous Substances and Amusement Devices Services
Department of Labour.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of information, education and enforcement services relating to the safe management of hazardous substances in the workplace, and the registration and inspection of amusement devices.

Department of Labour.name: Labour Market Information and Facilitation Services
Department of Labour.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of information and regional and sector engagement on labour market effectiveness and employment.

Department of Labour.name: Regulation of Immigration Advisers
Department of Labour.scope: This appropriation is limited to: the regulation of persons who provide immigration advice; facilitating the education and professional development of Immigration Advisers; and increasing public awareness of the Immigration Advisers Authority, pursuant to the functions described in section 35 of the Immigration Advisers Licensing Act 2007.

Department of Labour.name: Policy Advice - ACC
Department of Labour.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of advice (including second opinion advice and contributions to policy advice led by other agencies) to support decision-making by Ministers on government policy matters relating to the accident compensation system.

Department of Labour.name: International Labour Organisation
Department of Labour.scope: New Zealand's annual subscription to the ILO.

Department of Labour.name: Health and Safety in Employment Levy - Collection Services
Department of Labour.scope: Provision of collection services from the Accident Compensation Corporation (ACC), to collect the HSE Levy on behalf of the Department of Labour.

Department of Labour.name: Crown Entity Monitoring
Department of Labour.scope: This output class is limited to the purchase, appointment and monitoring advice on the Accident Compensation Corporation (ACC) and other accident compensation statutory bodies.

Department of Labour.name: Employment Relations Education Contestable Fund
Department of Labour.scope: Grant funding for programmes that promote improved employment relationships and good faith behaviour, and good health and safety practices amongst employers, unions and employees.

Department of Labour.name: Public Health Acute Services - Treatment Injuries for Non-Earners'
Department of Labour.scope: This appropriation is limited to fund public health acute services for claims by non-earners' on the Treatment Injury Account.

Department of Labour.name: Joint Equal Employment Opportunities Trust
Department of Labour.scope: Funding to promote EEO as a good management practice, delivered in partnership with the private sector.

Department of Labour.name: Regulatory Services
Department of Labour.scope: This appropriation is limited to the management of the residual long-term responsibility related to the Crown's ongoing risks resulting from the introduction of the competitive accident insurance market during 1999/2000.

Department of Labour.name: Bad Debt Expense
Department of Labour.scope: To cover the expected cost of writing off hearing fees for hearings of longer than a day in length at the Employment Court (hearings pre 1 December 2004) and the Employment Relations Authority where the applicant is granted hardship or where debt recovery is unsuccessful after three months.

Department of Labour.name: New Zealand Industrial Relations Foundation
Department of Labour.scope: Funding for education to promote better industrial relations.

Department of the Prime Minister and Cab.name: Intelligence Coordination and National Security Priorities
Department of the Prime Minister and Cab.scope: This output class is limited to leadership and coordination around national security matters, leading collaboration within the New Zealand intelligence community and providing intelligence assessments to support national security priorities.

Department of the Prime Minister and Cab.name: Support, Secretariat and Coordination Services
Department of the Prime Minister and Cab.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of services to Ministers to enable them to discharge their portfolio (other than policy decision-making) responsibilities including support for the coordination of the Government's legislation programme; secretariat services to the Executive Council, Cabinet and its committees; and administration of the New Zealand Honours system.

Department of the Prime Minister and Cab.name: Support Services to the Governor-General and Maintenance of the Official Residences
Department of the Prime Minister and Cab.scope: This output class is limited to financial, administrative, communications and advisory services for the Governor-General; and services to maintain the Governor-General's residences.

Department of the Prime Minister and Cab.name: Policy Advice - Prime Minister and Cabinet
Department of the Prime Minister and Cab.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of advice (including second opinion advice and contributions to policy advice led by other agencies) to support decision-making by the Prime Minister and the Cabinet.

Department of the Prime Minister and Cab.name: Department of the Prime Minister and Cabinet - Capital Expenditure
Department of the Prime Minister and Cab.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the Department of the Prime Minister and Cabinet, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

Department of the Prime Minister and Cab.name: Depreciation Expenses on Crown Assets
Department of the Prime Minister and Cab.scope: Depreciation expenses on Government Houses in Wellington and Auckland and their contents.

Department of the Prime Minister and Cab.name: Governor-General's Programme
Department of the Prime Minister and Cab.scope: This appropriation is limited to expenses incurred on the Governor-General's Programme, as authorised by section 13 of the Governor-General Act 2010.

Department of the Prime Minister and Cab.name: Government House - Capital Investment
Department of the Prime Minister and Cab.scope: This appropriation is limited to the conservation of the Government House, Wellington property to maintain or increase its on-going use, functionality, and value as a heritage asset; and purchases of and investment in capital items for Government House, Auckland.

Department of the Prime Minister and Cab.name: Science Advisory Committee
Department of the Prime Minister and Cab.scope: This output class is limited to the purchase of high-quality scientific advice to the Prime Minister.

Department of the Prime Minister and Cab.name: Governor-General's Salary and Allowance
Department of the Prime Minister and Cab.scope: This appropriation is limited to expenses incurred on the salary, allowance and other payments to the Governor-General, as authorised by section 12 of the Governor-General Act 2010.

Department of the Prime Minister and Cab.name: Governor-General's travel outside New Zealand
Department of the Prime Minister and Cab.scope: This appropriation is limited to expenses incurred on the Governor-General's travel outside New Zealand, as authorised by section 14 of the Governor-General Act 2010.

Department of the Prime Minister and Cab.name: Ex gratia payment to the University of Auckland
Department of the Prime Minister and Cab.scope: This appropriation is limited to ex gratia payments to the University of Auckland to enable continued support of Professor Sir Peter Gluckman's own specialised research programme during his membership of the Science Advisory Committee.

Department of the Prime Minister and Cab.name: Fees for the Commissioner of Security Warrants
Department of the Prime Minister and Cab.scope: The appropriation under permanent legislative authority (the NZSIS Amendment (No. 2) Act 1999) will provide for payments to the Commissioner as an independent judicial officer for the authorisation of domestic security warrants.

Education Review Office.name: Schools and Other Education Service Providers
Education Review Office.scope: This output class is limited to evaluations of the performance of schools and other education service providers.

Education Review Office.name: Early Childhood Education Services
Education Review Office.scope: This output class is limited to evaluations of the performance of early childhood education services.

Education Review Office.name: Quality of Education Reports and Services
Education Review Office.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of national education evaluation reports, policy services, ministerial and contractual services.

Education Review Office.name: Education Review Office - Capital Expenditure
Education Review Office.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the Education Review Office, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

Government Communications Security Burea.name: Communications Security and Intelligence
Government Communications Security Burea.scope: This appropriation is limited to the operating and investing activities of the Government Communications Security Bureau.

Inland Revenue Department.name: Family Tax Credit
Inland Revenue Department.scope: Family Support payments made to beneficiaries and non-beneficiaries during the year (expenses incurred pursuant to section 185 of the Tax Administration Act 1994).

Inland Revenue Department.name: Bad Debt Write-Offs
Inland Revenue Department.scope: This appropriation is limited to bad debt write-offs for Crown debt administered by Inland Revenue.

Inland Revenue Department.name: Initial Fair Value Write-Down - Student Loans
Inland Revenue Department.scope: This appropriation is limited to the initial fair value write-down of student loans.

Inland Revenue Department.name: In-Work Tax Credit
Inland Revenue Department.scope: Extra assistance for low to middle income families where the person works a minimum of 20 hours per week and does not have a partner, or a person and their partner work a minimum of 30 hours per week (expenses incurred pursuant to section 185 of the Tax Administration Act 1994).

Inland Revenue Department.name: KiwiSaver: Tax Credit
Inland Revenue Department.scope: To enable the payment of a tax credit to KiwiSaver members and the payment of residual tax credits to employers as set out in the Income Tax Act 2007.

Inland Revenue Department.name: Impairment of Debt Relating to Child Support
Inland Revenue Department.scope: This appropriation is limited to amounts relating to impairment arising from objective evidence of one or more loss events that occurred after the initial recognition of the debt, and the loss event (or events) has had a reliably measurable impact on the estimated future cash flows of the collective book of child support debt.

Inland Revenue Department.name: Services to Inform the Public About Entitlements and Meeting Obligations
Inland Revenue Department.scope: Providing information and assistance to customers on the application of the law.  Responding to customer enquiries about tax and social support programmes.  Adjudication on behalf of the Commissioner on proposed taxpayer assessments.  Providing binding rulings and other statements on the interpretation and application of the law administered by Inland Revenue.  Provision of services to Ministers to enable them to discharge their portfolio (other than policy decision-making responsibilities).

Inland Revenue Department.name: Impairment of Debt
Inland Revenue Department.scope: This appropriation is limited to amounts relating to impairment arising from objective evidence of one or more loss events that occurred after the initial recognition of the debt, and the loss event (or events) has had a reliably measurable impact on the estimated future cash flows of the Crown debt book.

Inland Revenue Department.name: Child Support Payments
Inland Revenue Department.scope: Child support payments to custodial persons who are not dependent on the state for financial support (expenses incurred pursuant to section 141 of the Child Support Act 1991).

Inland Revenue Department.name: KiwiSaver: Kickstart Payment
Inland Revenue Department.scope: To enable the one-off payment made on opening a KiwiSaver account for members who meet the required eligibility criteria as set in the KiwiSaver Act 2006.

Inland Revenue Department.name: Taxpayer Audit
Inland Revenue Department.scope: Identifying risks to revenue and designing and undertaking audit activities accordingly.  Managing litigation of disputed tax cases.

Inland Revenue Department.name: Paid Parental Leave Payments
Inland Revenue Department.scope: Paid Parental Leave Payments made to parents eligible under the Parental Leave and Employment Protection Act 1987.

Inland Revenue Department.name: Management of Debt and Outstanding Returns
Inland Revenue Department.scope: Taking action where returns are outstanding and where payments are overdue, including providing people with assistance on the actions they need to take to meet their obligations. This includes collection on behalf of other agencies and external parties.

Inland Revenue Department.name: Services to Process Obligations and Entitlements
Inland Revenue Department.scope: Registering tax payers, making tax assessments, assessing child support liabilities including providing a readily accessible inexpensive process for reviewing assessments, receiving and making payments to customers, processing applications and payments for social support programmes, collection of ACC Earners' levies, supplying information to other government agencies and accounting and reporting the collection of Crown revenue.

Inland Revenue Department.name: Impairment of Debt Relating to Student Loans
Inland Revenue Department.scope: This appropriation is limited to amounts relating to impairment arising from objective evidence of one or more loss events that occurred after the initial recognition of the loan, and the loss event (or events) has had a reliably measurable impact on the estimated future cash flows of the collective book of student loan debt.

Inland Revenue Department.name: Inland Revenue Department - Capital Expenditure
Inland Revenue Department.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the Inland Revenue Department, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

Inland Revenue Department.name: Parental Tax Credit
Inland Revenue Department.scope: To enable payment of additional financial support to be made to working families for the eight week period following the birth of a child (expenses incurred pursuant to section 185 of the Tax Administration Act 1994).

Inland Revenue Department.name: Minimum Family Tax Credit
Inland Revenue Department.scope: Extra payment made to families where at least one parent is working for salary or wages (expenses incurred pursuant to section 185 of the Tax Administration Act 1994).

Inland Revenue Department.name: Policy Advice
Inland Revenue Department.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision of advice (including second opinion advice and contributions to policy advice led by other agencies) to support decision-making by Ministers on government policy matters.

Inland Revenue Department.name: KiwiSaver: Interest
Inland Revenue Department.scope: To enable the payment of interest on KiwiSaver contributions as set out in the KiwiSaver Act 2006.

Inland Revenue Department.name: Income Equalisation Interest
Inland Revenue Department.scope: This appropriation is limited to interest on Income Equalisation Reserve Scheme accounts held by taxpayers in the farming, fishing or forestry industries (expenses incurred pursuant to section 185 of the Tax Administration Act 1994).

Inland Revenue Department.name: Payroll Subsidy
Inland Revenue Department.scope: To enable the payment of a subsidy to a payroll agent undertaking employers' payroll-related tax compliance activities on their behalf.

Inland Revenue Department.name: Environmental Restoration Account Interest
Inland Revenue Department.scope: This appropriation is limited to interest on Environmental Restoration accounts (expenses incurred pursuant to section 185 of the Tax Administration Act 1994).

Inland Revenue Department.name: Child Tax Credit
Inland Revenue Department.scope: Extra assistance for low to middle income families who are not dependent on the state for financial support (expenses incurred pursuant to section 185 of the Tax Administration Act 1994).

Inland Revenue Department.name: Adverse Event Interest
Inland Revenue Department.scope: This appropriation is limited to interest on Adverse Event Income Equalisation Reserve accounts held by taxpayers in the farming and agriculture business (expenses incurred pursuant to section 185 of the Tax Administration Act 1994).

Land Information New Zealand.name: Land and Seabed Data Capture and Processing
Land Information New Zealand.scope: The collection and authorisation of land data and information in accordance with the regulatory frameworks.

Land Information New Zealand.name: Land and Seabed Information Storage and Management
Land Information New Zealand.scope: Ensuring that the security and management of LINZ's databases and systems for land information are managed effectively and efficiently.

Land Information New Zealand.name: Crown Property Management and Disposal Services
Land Information New Zealand.scope: The management and disposal of the Crown's interest in land and property (outside of the conservation estate) and acquisition, management and disposal of land and property administered by the department on behalf of the Crown.

Land Information New Zealand.name: Proceeds from Sale of Transit NZ Properties
Land Information New Zealand.scope: To pay Transit NZ the equivalent of what the Crown has received from the sales of Transit properties.

Land Information New Zealand.name: Land Tenure Reform Acquisitions
Land Information New Zealand.scope: This appropriation is limited to the acquisition of the lessees' interest in pastoral lease land and purchase of any land and/or assets required to complete the acquisition of lessee interest in order to achieve Tenure Review outcomes under the Crown Pastoral Land Act 1998, or to achieve Government high country objectives.

Land Information New Zealand.name: Standards and Quality Assurance
Land Information New Zealand.scope: Ensuring that the regulatory frameworks that create and protect property rights, and protect the public interest in Crown property management, rating valuations and the land information for which LINZ is responsible, are managed effectively and that delivery against the frameworks is quality assured.

Land Information New Zealand.name: Land Information New Zealand - Capital Expenditure
Land Information New Zealand.scope: This appropriation is limited to the purchase or development of assets by and for the use of the Land Information New Zealand, as authorised by section 24(1) of the Public Finance Act 1989.

Land Information New Zealand.name: Land and Seabed Information Access and Dissemination
Land Information New Zealand.scope: The provision of access to, and dissemination of, information held by LINZ.

Land Information New Zealand.name: Administration of the Overseas Investment Act 2005
Land Information New Zealand.scope: This appropriation is limited to the assessing of applications, for consent to the acquisition of investments in New Zealand land, significant business assets and fishing quota; monitoring and enforcement.

Land Information New Zealand.name: Oceans Survey 20/20 Programme
Land Information New Zealand.scope: This appropriation is limited to the undertaking of initiatives within the Oceans Survey 20/20 Programme.

Land Information New Zealand.name: Policy Advice
Land Information New Zealand.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of advice (including second opinion advice and contributions to policy advice led by other agencies) to support decision-making by Ministers on government policy matters relating to land, property and geospatial information.

Land Information New Zealand.name: Administration of the New Zealand Geographic Board (Nga Pou Taunaha o Aotearoa) Act 2008
Land Information New Zealand.scope: This appropriation is limited to the expenses incurred under the New Zealand Geographic (Nga Pou Taunaha o Aotearoa) Act 2008, including: Board/Committee meetings, secretariat personnel, consultation, public advertising and publicity, national and international liaison and representation, and Board publications.

Land Information New Zealand.name: Crown Rates
Land Information New Zealand.scope: Payment of rates on Crown land and surplus government properties administered by the department on behalf of the Crown.

Land Information New Zealand.name: Crown Acquisitions - Huntly East
Land Information New Zealand.scope: Acquisition of properties falling within Cabinet's approved policy area for Huntly East subsidence zone.

Land Information New Zealand.name: Land Liabilities
Land Information New Zealand.scope: Investigation and resolution, including legal costs and settlement, of land-related liabilities administered by the department.

Land Information New Zealand.name: Ministerial Services, Appointments, Implementation and Operational Policy
Land Information New Zealand.scope: This output class is limited to the provision of services to Ministers to enable them to discharge their portfolio responsibilities, including appointments to boards, the implementation of policy decisions and development of operational policy.

Land Information New Zealand.name: Residual Crown Leasehold Rents
Land Information New Zealand.scope: Leasehold liabilities paid on residual surplus government accommodation administered by the department on behalf of the Crown.

Land Information New Zealand.name: Contaminated Sites
Land Information New Zealand.scope: Analysis, investigation and, where necessary, appropriate remedial action on contaminated sites for which the Crown has accepted responsibility.

Land Information New Zealand.name: Crown Forest Management
Land Information New Zealand.scope: Management of Crown forest properties and licences, including settling reviews, interest liability and GST on refunded fees.

Land Information New Zealand.name: Depreciation
Land Information New Zealand.scope: This appropriation is limited to depreciation of buildings on surplus Crown land.

Land Information New Zealand.name: Bad and Doubtful Debts
Land Information New Zealand.scope: This appropriation is limited to the provision for writing off bad and doubtful debts.

Ministry for Culture and Heritage.name: Public Broadcasting Services
Ministry for Culture and Heritage.scope: This appropriation is limited to providing funding for New Zealand television and radio programmes, music, archiving, broadcasting and transmission coverage; maintenance of codes and determination of complaints on broadcasting standards; and funding a national Pacific radio network and international radio and television services to the Pacific.

Ministry for Culture and Heritage.name: High Performance Sport
Ministry for Culture and Heritage.scope: This appropriation is limited to delivery of initiatives aimed at improved sports performance at the elite level.

Ministry for Culture and Heritage.name: Museum Services
Ministry for Culture and Heritage.scope: Collection development, collection management, public programmes and exhibitions, and repatriation of koiwi tangata.

Ministry for Culture and Heritage.name: New Zealand Screen Production Incentive Fund
Ministry for Culture and Heritage.scope: This appropriation is limited to grant payments for eligible producers of New Zealand feature film, television or other format screen productions that meet the qualifying tests as set by the New Zealand Film Commission, and co-investment by the New Zealand Film Commission in such productions.

Ministry for Culture and Heritage.name: Performing Arts Services
Ministry for Culture and Heritage.scope: Providing opportunities for New Zealand audiences to experience high-quality live symphonic music, ballet and kapa haka performances; supporting the growth of the contemporary music industry; and encouraging participation in and appreciation of these art forms in New Zealand.

Ministry for Culture and Heritage.name: Sport and Recreation Programmes
Ministry for Culture and Heritage.scope: This appropriation is limited to delivery of programmes in accordance with Sport New Zealand's statutory functions to promote, encourage and support sport and recreation in New Zealand, and the provision of policy advice on and information relating to sport and recreation, including ministerial servicing.

Ministry for Culture and Heritage.name: Promotion and Support of the Arts and Film
Ministry for Culture and Heritage.scope: Contributing to the development of New Zealand’s cultural identity and international profile; supporting access and participation by New Zealanders in the arts; encouraging and recognising innovation and excellence through the support of new work and presentation of New Zealand arts and film to New Zealanders.

Ministry for Culture and Heritage.name: Management of Historic Places
Ministry for Culture and Heritage.scope: Identification, registration, site recording and associated promotion of the conservation, protection and care of historic places, and purchasing of management services for properties, including maintenance work and provision of access for the public.

Ministry for Culture and Heritage.name: Heritage Services
Ministry for Culture and Heritage.scope: Management of new memorial projects, national monuments, war and historic graves; promotion of cultural events; administration of legislation and grants; and research, writing and publication of New Zealand history and reference works including the on-line encyclopedia of New Zealand.

Ministry for Culture and Heritage.name: Delivery of Going Digital Programme
Ministry for Culture and Heritage.scope: This appropriation is limited to services to support the transition to digital television by December 2013.

Ministry for Culture and Heritage.name: Regional Museums
Ministry for Culture and Heritage.scope: This appropriation is limited to providing contributions to capital construction projects at Regional Museums.

Ministry for Culture and Heritage.name: Going Digital Targeted Assistance Package
